sect2.title: Oracle
sect2.para: This section explains how to configure an Oracle database.

sect3.title: Requirements
sect3.para: In order to use an Oracle database in Wolframe you have to configure the loading of the module mod_db_oracle in the LoadModules section of your configuration. The addressed Oracle database server must be running and the database and the user configured must have been created before.

sect2.sect3:
Configuration settings
The configuration settings for Oracle are splitted in two parts: The database configuration settings and the SSL configuration settings. The following three tables show the Oracle database configuration settings, the Oracle SSL configuration settings and the table with configurable SSL modes:
Oracle database configuration settings
Name Parameter Description
Identifier identifier Database identifier used to reference this database.
Host identifier or string Address of the Oracle database server
Port number Port of the Oracle database server
Database identifier Name of the database to connect to
User identifier User to connect to the database with
Password string Password to connect to the database with
ConnectionTimeout number Connection timeout in seconds
Connections number Maximum number of simoultaneus database connections (size of connection pool)
AcquireTimeout number Maximum time allowed to acquire a database connection in seconds
StatementTimeout number The maximum allowed time to execute a statement in milliseconds.
&AppConfigDatabaseOracleSslOptionTable; &AppConfigDatabaseOracleSslModeTable;

sect3.title: Example configuration
sect3.para: Here follows an example Oracle database configuration:
sect3.programlisting: Database { Oracle { Identifier oradb Host localhost Port 1521 Database orcl User wolfusr Password wolfpwd ConnectionTimeout 10 Connections 40 AcquireTimeout 10 } }
